Jots is an open-source minimalistic notes app. It was created by Tadeas Jun in 2021. The app features a minimal UI, which can be personalized via the Themes in the Theme Store of the app. \nIf you\'re a developer, you can view the complete code of Jots in its GitHub repository, available via the main menu of the app. As the main purpose of the app being open-source is to showcase the author\'s experience in Android development, the GitHub repo is not accepting any pull requests, and does not allow redistribution and/or modification.
A portrait photo of Tadeas, the app\'s author. He is wearing a coat. The background of the photo is the bisexual pride flag.

Tadeas Jun is a freelance developer and a writer. He created the Art Prompts series of projects, including an Android app, a Discord bot, a newsletter, and a Twitch bot. On his blog, Eledris, he writes about worldbuilding and creative writing. \nTadeas\' minor projects include the Figma plugin Pride Flags & Gradients, the trivia Discord bot DisTriv, and a work-in-progress blog about LGBTQ oppression.

To reach out to Tadeas, please feel free to email tadeas@eledris.com. \nFor a less formal conversation, Tadeas is usually online on Discord under the tag Tadeas Salvatore Jun#9537 - send him a friend request! \nIf you\'d like to leave some feedback on this app, please send us a review on Google Play.
